sen.j: 竹輪（ちくわ）は、魚肉のすりみを竹など棒に巻きつけて焼いたもの、または蒸した食品。
sen.e: Chikuwa is baked or steamed fishcake which fish paste was wrapped around stick or bamboo stick.
Chikuwa is baked or steamed fishcake, in which fish paste was wrapped around stick or bamboo stick.
Chikuwa is baked or steamed fishcake, in which fish paste is wrapped around stick or bamboo stick.

sen.j: 魚肉練り製品のひとつ。
sen.e: It is one of boiled fish-paste products.
It is a boiled fish-paste products.
It is one of the boiled fish-paste products.

sen.j: 串を抜くと筒状になり、竹の切り口に似ているためこの名が付いた。
sen.e: There is a hole in the middle once the stick is taken out, it is called Chikuwa (the edge of the cut bamboo tree) since the shape looks similar to it.
There is a hole in the middle once the stick is taken out, it is called Chikuwa (the edge of the cut bamboo tree) since the shape looks similar to it.
There is a hole in the middle once the stick is taken out, it is called Chikuwa (the edge of the cut bamboo tree) since the shape looks similar to it.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: The history
History
History

sen.j: 竹輪の起源は弥生時代とも平安時代ともいわれはっきりしないが、いくつかの室町時代以降の書物に蒲鉾という名で記されている。
sen.e: The origin of Chikuwa is said to be Yayoi period or Heian period but the detail is not known, however there are some written record of Chikuwa after the Muromachi period.
The origin of Chikuwa is said to be the Yayoi period or Heian period but there is some uncertainty, however there are written records of Chikuwa after the Muromachi period.
The origin of Chikuwa is said to be the Yayoi period or Heian period but there is some uncertainty, however there are written records of Chikuwa after the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 江戸時代前には形状が蒲の穂に似ていたため蒲鉾と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: In Edo period it was called 'Kamaboko' (cattail) kamaboko (boiled fish paste) since the shape was similar to the cattail plant.
In the Edo period it was called 'Kamaboko' (cattail) because the shape was similar to the cattail plant.
In the Edo period it was called 'Kamaboko' (cattail) because the shape was similar to the cattail plant.

sen.j: 後に、板の上にすり身をのせた形状の板蒲鉾（現代の蒲鉾）が現れ、それと区別するために竹輪蒲鉾と呼び、略して竹輪と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: Later on Itakamaboko (current Kamaboko) which fishcake was put on to p of piece of wood came to the market, Chikuwa was called Chikuwa Kamaboko to distinguish from Chikuwa, since then the name was shortened to be called Chikuwa.

Later on when Itakamaboko (current Kamaboko), in which fishcake was put on top of a piece of wood came to the market, Chikuwa was called Chikuwa Kamaboko to distinguish it from Chikuwa, after which the name was shortened to Chikuwa.

Later on when Itakamaboko (current Kamaboko), in which fishcake was put on top of a piece of wood came to the market, Chikuwa was called Chikuwa Kamaboko to distinguish it from Chikuwa, after which the name was shortened to Chikuwa.

sen.j: 江戸時代までは高級品だった。
sen.e: It was high quality food until Edo period.
It was a high class food until the Edo period.
It was a high class food until the Edo period.

sen.j: 製法・種類
sen.e: The way how to make it, the type of Chikuwa
Manufacturing Method, Types
Manufacturing Method, Types

sen.j: タラスケトウダラ・サメ・トビウオ・ホッケなどの魚肉に塩・砂糖・デンプン・卵白などを加えて練り、竹製や金属製の太い串に棒状に塗りつけ、焼くか蒸し上げる。
sen.e: Mix fish meat of suketo cod (Alaska Pollock, or Theragra chalcogramma), shark, flying fish, Atka mackerel (fish) with salt, sugar, starch, egg white and kneated, it is then put on thick bamboo or metal stick to be baked or steamed.

Mix fish meat of suketo cod (Alaska Pollock, or Theragra chalcogramma), shark, flying fish and Atka mackerel with salt, sugar, starch and egg white and knead, then put on thick bamboo or metal sticks to be baked or steamed.
sen.cmt: confusion of the subject; use “and” before the last item in a list; spelling
sen.e: Mix fish meat of suketo cod (Alaska Pollock, or Theragra chalcogramma), shark, flying fish and Atka mackerel with salt, sugar, starch and egg white and knead, then put on thick bamboo or metal sticks to be baked or steamed.

sen.j: 焼いたものは焼き竹輪と呼ばれ、蒸したものは蒸し竹輪、白ちくわなどと呼ばれる。
sen.e: The ones which were baked are called Yakichikuwa (baked Chikuwa) and the steamed ones are called Mushichikuwa (steamed Chikuwa) or white Chikuwa.
The baked kind are called Yakichikuwa and the steamed ones are called Mushichikuwa or white Chikuwa.
The baked kind are called Yakichikuwa and the steamed ones are called Mushichikuwa or white Chikuwa.

sen.j: 現代の主流は焼き竹輪であり、ほとんどの場合機械によって自動的に焼き上げられる。
sen.e: The main Chikuwa at present is Yakichikuwa and most of them are made by machine and automatically baked.
The main Chikuwa at present is Yakichikuwa and most of them are made by machine and automatically baked.
The main Chikuwa at present is Yakichikuwa and most of them are made by machine and automatically baked.

sen.j: 保存の際、冷凍される焼き竹輪は冷凍焼き竹輪と呼ばれ、冷凍しないものは生ちくわと呼ばれる。
sen.e: The ones which are kept in the freezer to keep were called frozen baked Chikuwa and the other fresh ones are called fresh Chikuwa.
The ones which are kept in the freezer to keep were called frozen baked Chikuwa and the other fresh ones are called fresh Chikuwa.
The ones which are kept in the freezer are called frozen baked Chikuwa and the other fresh ones are called fresh Chikuwa.
sen.cmt: kept in the freezer to keep→kept in the freezerのみとし、were→areに修正

sen.j: 地域によって用いる魚、形、味にそれぞれ特徴がある。
sen.e: The type of fish being used, the shape and taste of the Chikuwa varies depending on different places.
The type of fish used, the shape and taste of the Chikuwa varies from place to place.
The type of fish used, the shape and taste of the Chikuwa vary from place to place.

sen.j: 各地の竹輪
sen.e: Chikuwa in various places
Chikuwa in various places
Chikuwa in Various Places
sen.cmt: 表記統一のため、単語の頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 島根県の野焼きちくわ、鳥取県の豆腐ちくわ、広島県、岡山県の豆ちくわ、山陰の手握りちくわ、熊本県の日奈久ちくわ、愛知県の豊橋竹輪、徳島県の竹輪など、日本では各地で作られる。
sen.e: There are many Chikuwa made in Japan such as noyaki chikuwa (chikuwa grilled in the field, which ingredient is ground flying fish) in Shimane Prefecture, tofu chikuwa of Tottori Prefecture, mame (beans) chikuwa of Hiroshima and Okayama Prefecture, tenigiri chikuwa (chikuwa shaped by hand) of Sanin, Hinagu chikuwa (chikuwa made in Hinagu region of Kumamoto) of Kumamoto Prefecture, Toyohashi Chikuwa of Aichi Prefecture, Chikuwa in Tokushima Prefecture and so on.

There are many Chikuwa made in Japan such as noyaki chikuwa (chikuwa grilled in the field, made from flying fish) in Shimane Prefecture, tofu chikuwa of Tottori Prefecture, bean chikuwa of Hiroshima and Okayama Prefecture, tenigiri chikuwa (chikuwa shaped by hand) of Sanin, Hinagu chikuwa (chikuwa made in Hinagu region of Kumamoto) of Kumamoto Prefecture, Toyohashi Chikuwa of Aichi Prefecture, Chikuwa in Tokushima Prefecture and so on.

There are many Chikuwa made in Japan such as noyaki chikuwa (chikuwa grilled in the field, made from flying fish) in Shimane Prefecture, tofu chikuwa of Tottori Prefecture, bean chikuwa of Hiroshima and Okayama Prefectures, tenigiri chikuwa (chikuwa shaped by hand) of Sanin region, Hinagu chikuwa (chikuwa made in Hinagu region of Kumamoto) of Kumamoto Prefecture, Toyohashi Chikuwa of Aichi Prefecture, Chikuwa in Tokushima Prefecture and so on.
sen.cmt: Hiroshima and Okayama Prefecture→Hiroshima and Okayama Prefecturesに修正、Sanin→Sanin regionとしました。

sen.j: 愛知県、長野県などでは、ビタミンA、ビタミンEなどを含んだ魚油が添加された「ビタミンちくわ」が販売されている。
sen.e: In Aichi and Nagano Prefecture, there are 'Vitamin Chikuwa' for sale which fish oil contains vitamin A and vitamin E is added to Chikuwa.
In Aichi and Nagano Prefecture, there are 'Vitamin Chikuwa' for sale, which contain fish oil with vitamin A E added.
In Aichi and Nagano Prefectures, there are 'Vitamin Chikuwa' for sale, which contain fish oil with vitamin A E added.

sen.j: 愛媛県八幡浜市の「皮ちくわ」は竹輪の魚肉を取り去った後に残る皮を10本程を串に巻き、焼き上げたもので、足とうま味が異なる。
sen.e: Kawa Chikuwa' in Yawatahama City, Ehime Prefecture has only ten Chikuwa skin, which are left after taking fish cakes away from Chikuwa, wrapped around the stick and baked, it has different taste compare to ordinary Chikuwa.
sen.cmt: 足とうま味→味とうまみと解釈しました。
sen.e: Kawa Chikuwa in Yawatahama City, Ehime Prefecture, has only ten Chikuwa skin, which are left after taking fish cakes away from Chikuwa, wrapped around the stick and baked, it has different taste compared to ordinary Chikuwa.

Kawa Chikuwa in Yawatahama City, Ehime Prefecture, has only ten Chikuwa skin, which are left after taking fish cakes away from Chikuwa, wrapped around the stick and baked, it has different taste compared to ordinary Chikuwa.

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 「竹輪」以外に、魚偏に◎で「ちくわ」と読む。
sen.e: The Kanji character of Chikuwa (竹輪) is also written in different Kanji style, 魚◎ and pronounce as chikuwa.
The Kanji characters for Chikuwa (竹輪) can also be written like 魚◎ (fish on the left with a ring on the right) and pronounce as chikuwa.
The Kanji characters for Chikuwa (竹輪) can also be written like 魚◎ (fish on the left with a ring on the right) and pronounce as chikuwa.

sen.j: 国字（和製漢字）。
sen.e: Kokuji, (native script, kana) (Japanese Kanji)
Kokuji (Japanese Kanji)
Kokuji (Japanese Kanji).

sen.j: この字は、今昔文字鏡10万字バージョンのに収録されている。
sen.e: This character is printed in one hundred thousand version of 今昔文字鏡.
sen.cmt: 今昔文字鏡→読み方、定訳不明
sen.e: This character is listed the one hundred thousand character version of 今昔文字鏡.
This character is listed the one hundred thousand character version of Konjaku Mojikyo.
sen.cmt: 今昔文字鏡→Konjaku Mojikyoとしました。(参考: http://www.mojikyo.com/)

sen.j: 竹輪の穴にチーズを挟んだものは「チーズちくわ」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The Chikuwa with cheese in the hole is called 'cheese Chikuwa.'
Chikuwa with cheese in the hole is called 'cheese Chikuwa.'
Chikuwa with cheese in the hole is called 'cheese Chikuwa.'

sen.j: 竹輪の皮にチーズを挟んだものは「チーちく」（株式会社紀文食品のみ製造・販売。商品名である。）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: The Chikuwa with cheese in the chikuwa skin is called 'Chee Chiku.' (It is only made and sold by Kibun Foods Inc, Co., Ltd.)
The Chikuwa with cheese in the chikuwa skin is called 'Chee Chiku.' (It is only made and sold by Kibun Foods Inc, Co., Ltd.)
The Chikuwa with cheese in the chikuwa skin is called 'Chee Chiku' (It is only made and sold by Kibun Foods Inc, Co., Ltd. 'Chee Chiku' is a brand name.).
sen.cmt: 「商品名である」→訳漏れのため訳出、ピリオドの位置を移動

sen.j: 穴が開いていて風通しが良いことから転じて、発言を聞き流してしまう人に対して「竹輪の耳」を持つ人と呼ぶことがある。
sen.e: Since Chikuwa has a hole to let breeze through, people who tend to miss other people's speech are called someone who have 'Chikuwa ears.'
Since Chikuwa has a hole to let air through, people who tend to miss other people's speech are said to have 'Chikuwa ears.'
Since Chikuwa has a hole to let air through, people who tend to miss other people's speech are said to have 'Chikuwa ears.'

sen.j: 竹輪に似た食品にちくわぶ（竹輪麩）があるが、ちくわぶは小麦粉を原料とする麩の一種であり魚肉練り製品ではない。
sen.e: There is a food called chikuwabu (a tube-shaped cake of flour paste) which is similar to Chikuwa, however chikuwabu is type of fu (cake of flour paste) which is made out of wheat flour, and is not kneaded fish cake.

There is a food called chikuwabu (a tube-shaped cake of flour paste) which is similar to Chikuwa, however chikuwabu is type of fu (cake of flour paste) which is made out of wheat flour, and is not kneaded fish cake.

There is a food called chikuwabu (a tube-shaped cake of flour paste) which is similar to Chikuwa, however chikuwabu is type of fu (cake of flour paste) which is made out of wheat flour, and is not kneaded fish cake.
